channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Palace: No special session for 'Bayanihan' 2
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Presidential spokesman Harry Roque said lawmakers can take up the measure when they start their regular session in two weeks.

item.title: Senators twit Duque over 'flattened the curve' claim
item.description: Two senators on Wednesday slammed Health Secretary Francisco Duque III for saying the country had successfully flattened the coronavirus epidemic curve since April.

item.title: WATCH: Duque briefly claims Philippines has flattened COVID-19 curve
item.author: Efigenio Toledo IV
item.description: Duque has since clarified that the curve has been bent, not flattened.

item.title: Palace: No 'house-to-house' search for cops
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The police won't conduct house-to-house search to find persons with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), Malacañang clarified Wednesday, as it claimed that staying in quarantine sites is not like imprisonment but going on a "paid for vacation."

item.title: Confirmed COVID-19 infections in Philippines now at 58,850
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: (Update 1, 6:09 p.m.) The novel coronavirus pandemic has killed more than 578,000 people out of at least 13.23 million infected worldwide.

item.title: Calls of 'paid' trolls won't make Pangilinan leave Senate charter panel
item.description: The hashtag #OustKiko has been topping Twitter’s trending topic since Wednesday morning. It has garnered over 19,000 tweets as of writing.

item.title: Health workers to lead 'Oplan Kalinga', but house-to-house ops still unclear
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: “We assure the public that we are implementing this for the sake of public health, for the protection of everybody."

item.title: 'Dismantling oligarchy' means fewer dynasties, stronger parties — Drilon
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: Three of the president's children currently hold elected positions: Rep. Paolo Duterte, Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte-Carpio and Davao City Vice Mayor Sebastian Duterte.

item.title: Cases still rising but Duque says Philippines has flattened coronavirus curve
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: (Update 1, 4:53 p.m.) Duque’s definition of flattening the curve goes against those in other countries where flattening means a consistent decrease in daily cases.

item.title: Philippines, China agree to manage West Philippine Sea row through 'friendly consultation'
item.author: Patricia Lourdes Viray
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. and Chinese State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Yi discussed the issue during a virtual meeting on Tuesday afternoon upon the request of the latter.
